ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Aerosol observation by the photoacoustic spectrometer at Nagoya, Japan
ResourceHeader.Description: Aerosol optical properties obtained by the photoacoustic spectrometer at Nagoya, Japan. Using the photoacoustic spectrometer (PASS-3, DMT Inc.), aerosol light absorption and scattering coefficients at 405 and 781 nm were measured. For more information, please check Nakayama et al., Properties of light-absorbing aerosols in the Nagoya urban area, Japan, in August 2011 and January 2012: Contributions of brown carbon and lensing effect, Journal of Geophysical Research Atmosphere, 119, 12,721-12,739, doi:10.1002/2014JD021744. Digital data are available upon request to PI.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: The data are available only for scientific research use. Please contact the Principal Investigator (Tomoki Nakayama) for the details.
